bJolSXPGQs-_wm0GoGkcZw.text: home-made cod fish finger sandwich - 5/10 - the fish was well cooked but bland. Tartar sauce was good and may have saved the sandwich if there was more. Sandwich was dry overall.

8M6wx1cM4QtgtEkvPQSsiA.text: A nice atmosphere, but we went on Saturday morning (early). The staff were friendly but seemed to forget we were even there for about 25 minutes, and then got our drinks wrong. The coffee was good, and the food was fine when it arrived.

8YUShGh-P2ICB8feOnNbiw.text: the mini donuts are sooo good.  hot and seved w strawberrys and chocolate dipping sauce.  these made up for the medicore service

PVT4oSXXChKGqJgLRrM84w.text: I've been to the Bill's in Covent Garden as well as to the one in Lewes, where Bill got his start.  I'm a fan.  The food is made from fresh, local produce and is relatively good value.  It's also a visual delight: pots of jams and preserves line the walls cheerfully.  Highly recommended.

5dydXCcCZBqtaBhpPL_yUw.text: I really like the Bill's in Brighton, so it is somewhat reluctantly that I give this Bill's only 3 stars. Things I love about Bill's in London:-tasty, reasonably priced food-diverse menu with plenty of choices for vegetarians, omnivores and carnivores alike-friendly servers who allowed our large group of friends to completely take over the big table in the centre of the restaurant and set up shop for 3.5 hours.Things I feel reservations about:-It feels like it's becoming a chain. The interior is just TOO much like the Bill's in Brighton, and in this setting, it feels contrived for some reason. I wish there was something a bit more unique about the inside that distinguished it from the other Bill's.-The location is sort of dreary. It's in a bit of a mall-like establishment just off Long Acre, squeezed between a Jamie's Italian and other chain establishments. This worries me.Still, I have no complaints about the dinner we had at Bill's. It really didn't let me down, and it was a good spot to gather with a big crowd.

YWiIItOXWLSLVVTDDWkVSg.text: Great casual breakfast experience. The atmosphere and quality of the food show that they pay attention to detail and value their customers! Loved the vegetarian breakfast. Also free wifi is always great!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Billy's vegetarian breakfast
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bubble & Squeak mustard mash

OzcmH-0bgSIQMSuNtXY_nw.text: The original branch of Bill's opened in Lewes, East Sussex in 2001 with a simple plan to combine an old-fashioned grocer (baskets of local fruit and veg) with a mid-market deli (displays of own-label jam, olive oil and Continental treats). It has been transformed in a hidden part of Covent Garden into an informal café serving an unpretentious British/Med menu.Follow @shark4chipdrink

HcG9s9aI-GUwqPZfADtSig.text: I went to Bill's with a couple of friends. At first they told us it would be a half hour wait, then they said we could only have our table for an hour and a half. They seated us upstairs, even though one of my friends was on crutches from a broken ankle. So far, so not good.The service after that was good, if a bit rushed. I had the Halloumi and Hummus sandwich, which is ok. The roasted red peppers could have been roasted more as they were almost uncooked. It was a relatively tasty burger but nothing special.Probably won't go back for dinner, but the breakfast is supposed to be good so I might come back for that.

KYd-EzALOpwV3aJcmhr8Bg.text: I am a big fan of Bill's in Brighton, and was looking forward to being able to eat the same food in my home city. But it's just not the same.Maybe it's the building, the menu seems smaller, and the staff less enthused. Whatever it is, think I'll just wait till I'm next in Brighton.

rc3OHD_WpDkiu9cd5D1hUQ.text: Loved the place! Myself, my wife and my 2 kids ate breakfast there 2 days in a row and on the 3rd day we had lunch there. Simple but very tasty breakfast's and lunch outstanding! We'll all be back!

U5icI373FbUPKQe3JJQxmA.text: Nice casual place to grab brunch. Good value for money

C_T4cfvAgJE3ajLyO3uFPg.text: This place was nothing short of a disaster.  We went in around 1:30pm for lunch on a Friday.  They told us it would be a 10 minute wait and gave us menus.  Well after 10+ minutes we noticed how many empty tables there were, and they informed us that the kitchen was "blocked" because they had had such a rush on tables and that they wouldn't seat us because they couldn't take our order because they wouldn't serve us for a while.  We convinced them to let us sit to take a load off our feet and to at least order some drinks.  We were after 15 minutes allowed to order.  The food was decent--I had a tasty burger although it came a bit too rare and the chips were good.It was pricey, service even once the kitchen was opened was not great, and you would think they would have their act together.  The only good thing about this place is the Fairtrade basmati rice sold in Fairtrade cotton bags.

yjHHSCrDyubjPKr2Q1sZDg.text: A place I discovered a month ago or so when I decided to find a new place in Covent Garden as I was a bit bored of the places I know. So I walked through St Martin's Courtyard and saw a nice casual place right next to Jamie Oliver's restaurant, which was busy as usual. So I decided to go in this place and I loved it from the moment I entered. I probably wasn't objective as I entered I saw the very tall wall on the left, with all the produce displayed delicatessen style and I just fell in love with it. I didn't experience the slow service that the reviews below describe, as I was seated straightaway although they were pretty busy. There was a couple of tables available inside and in the terrace. The glass doors were fully open as it was quite warm so being inside was very pleasant too, so we stayed in and enjoy the place's atmosphere. On that occassion I wasn't really hungry so we shared a mezze board. The food served was really taste and it had all been done in-house, which was noticeable. However, its size was not generous, so it was a good thing that we weren't too hungry that day. I then had a hot choc and a brownie and both were yummy (and I am a choc expert, me ;) I then have been back for a full English breakfast, which was really lovely. I sat outside that day, on one of these gorgeous sunny days we have had recently, and it really is a very enjoyable terrace right next to Picadillly and Covent Garden, as there is not a road in sight and you feel quite away from the hustle and bustle (except for the traffic noise, unfortunately) I have been back another couple of times for a coffee and a cake, and it is definitely a good option for this too to take a break from a shopping trip in Covent Garden. Finally, I went last Saturday night and I was quite hungry this time. I had the chicken, chorizo and butterbean stew, and it was delish! Plus the portion was generous too, which helps :) Oh, and it was good quality chorizo too, which was appreciated. Next time I will go and explore the produce they sell more and will probably buy a couple. I have taken a few different people here and everyone really liked it and found it different and a great option to know of in the Covent Garden area. Oh, the service has been always friendly. Another plus point. If there was one negative thing that I should say is that I find some dishes a bit overpriced, but overall it is ok.

r4D729E9NR9ED6NN2F_JSQ.text: A London friend took us to dinner here before dashing off for a play. It was fabulous food and a cool rustic atmosphere. Really fresh and delicious. I had the roast chicken which was cooked to perfection. I gave it four stars because friends weren't as thrilled with theirs as i was but still liked it fine. Hard to find this place but worth it!

QPyPYkgAYohIN8VRRJIu_w.text: Bill's came on a recommendation from a concierge and it sounded like it was going to keep me away from pub food so I bit. On finding that this was a concept specialty foods market plus restaurant I became a bit hesitant - places like this tend to trade on their cuteness and Bill's looked like no exception. Dried peppers hanging from the ceiling, shelves stocked with the bright labels of Bill's branded chutney, Bill's branded beans, Bill's branded elderflower syrup.  It all seemed a bit too conscientious about it's own atmosphere.  But I was too hungry to go anywhere else and too afraid that all that I'd find was a pub with microwaved beef pasties for lunch. The busy restaurant was out of some of the breakfast items by the time I was seated late into Sunday brunch but, the burgers being walked by on wood planks looked good  and there was a  nice selection of vegetarian items on the menu. Many items on the have a Mediterranean and Moroccan  bent to them and I settled on the halloumi and hummus sandwich served with chips (that's fries to Yanks like me). The sandwich didn't disappoint: it is served on a heartier hamburger bun, the halloumi lightly grilled and the sandwich spread with hummus and mild pepper sauce - all very mild.The invitation to 'shop from your table' is a bit weird - I'm not sure that I'd ever want to stock my larder while out to brunch but perhaps this let's the time compressed have an extra glass of prosecco and still get their Sunday grocery shopping done.

DZP3QxxBE_pgpeA7qV_P1Q.text: Firstly, I have to say that the decor is pretty awesome. I went their with my newspaper-and-chill-with-tea-friend and spent more time pointing out quirks than reading my paper. Quality of food is perfectly fine, nothing outstandingly special, but for Covent Garden and the price.. it's a pretty good steal. The teapots are pretty great too - but I know I have a thing for a good teapot. Only two downsides, the staff are a little bit slow and the brunch is only served until 1200 so not somewhere to rock up at with a late afternoon hangover. Sort of place that you could take the parents, maybe!?

ZWpfaFw-9KbnjB4HbwHykA.text: You know when something just tastes perfect? I had the cottage pie and it was under a tenner. It was so well made, it was the kind of dish you never want to end but know that it has to. My mate got the fish finger sandwich (a personal favourite of mine) and I tried a couple of her fries and they were beautiful. Really fresh, well made food!

R5zQz1HOJsiyufdiDyfm_w.text: Excellent, bright, airy restaurant in Covent Garden.  Great place to relax and have breakfast.  Their French Toast is exceptional and the atmosphere is casual.  The restaurant is filled with homemade jams and preserves, along with other specialties.  Worth a visit.

7hj3Z9jRp55yNu3IZCu0Jg.text: It is a great place. I work in the area and often go to Bill's for breakfast.

NNSo808X1dfaRhhJq2bKlQ.text: Bill's is a rather odd location for breakfast. Its in the heart of the touristy Covent Garden and yet hard to find (in fact, two of us couldn't even make it here that morning ... having lost their way).Having said that its an unusual, and not so little coffee shop (its spread over two floors). It seems that their major business is selling a number of household food items like jams and juices etc, rather than cooked food. The menu was quite limited ... a few standard variations of eggs and bread and english breakfast, which disappointed me. I usually prefer pancakes or french toast for breakfast.The food was quite good. I got an english breakfast. The sausage was a bit different than usual. I chose to have "bubble and squeak" instead of the baked beans. Who knew that fried leftover vegetables could taste so good :)However the service was not the best. It was slow and unresponsive. I didn't want the tomato in my breakfast and requested them to instead give me an extra egg. I have made such requests at several other places and it had never been refused, except for here. Then i asked them not to get me the tomato ... i didn't want to waste it. But they brought me that anyway.On the positive side they make some good fresh juices which you should try if you ever visit. The price is not exorbitant. I imagine it would be a nice place for an early riser tourist.

Z4B0hyKOvArEEvIZgxVp2A.text: Definitely one of the cutest eateries in Covent Garden, Bill's is the perfect spot to escape the tourist mainstream. With an original menu and adorable decor, Bill's is affordable and definitely worth checking out for a cocktail or for dinner.

XAaty_24fA9jkOsE1pwDZg.text: This was my favourite place for breakfast in London, until today. Cold bubble and squeak, soggy toast, cold & raw eggs, tiny portions. Very, very disappointed. The front of house team change every time we are in, which makes me question the consistency in their chefs. Really won't be back, will stick to Bills in Brighton.  Feel ripped off!!

eLuSDzVoPliKGUPjDBFbLg.text: Visited on 29th March 2011 for our breakfast, about 0900. Breakfast was "pretty" enough on the plate - I had a full english and my wife had scrambled eggs on toast, but it was only luke warm at best. Service was slow and inefficient even though there were only about half a dozen people in, including us, and loads of staff. It's a wee bit out of the way, not being on a main road and I'm not sure if it was really worth the effort. Plently of other place every bit as good, (but not so "posh"), in the area at almost half the price. Certainly not worth the hype, nor the money.

NaYmyPup_QQKkhN5L4jXzQ.text: The place looks great but I encountered a moody, incredibly unhelpful server. The place had 5 people eating and was not busy in the slightest. I asked for an Eggs Benedict but was informed that I had arrived after the midday cutoff for breakfast.  I then asked if the server would mind asking the chef as the restaurant was at 10% capacity and as the dish is very quick to prepare.The answer I received was a stern - NO. There was zero attempt to aid my query or suggest any alternative dish. For a restaurant that is renouned for it's breakfast/brunch I would have expected my short haired female member of staff to have ar least tried to help a customer.After such an ill considered rude response, delivered with bad vibes I left instantly. 0/10

E919ci_GJIBx-GjhS8crAQ.text: Breakfast at Bill's they all cried.Trust me, we were close to crying at the end.  I ordered pancakes.  Wife ordered Eggs BenedictMy pancakes were OK, nothing to shout about and remember, these are American-style pancakes.  Even I can do a good pancake.  The maple syrup on their was scrooge-like (by the end, I was sweeping pieces of pancake across my plate to suck up the drying remains of the maple syrup (which was of the worse quality, I have tasted good syrups - Maine, Vermont etc and bad ones - sugar syrup from McD.  This was of the latter).  At least I was lucky enough to get a brekkie.The wife's eggs benedict when arrived was HARD-BOILED.  You could hard-boil and egg and still be softer than how it arrived.  Again, a poached egg.  Its boiling water, chuck an egg in, turn water off and leave for three mins.  You dont need to be Jamie Oliver.  The hollandaise sauce that she got must have again, been rashioned or its one of those posh eats where less is more.Drinks were expensive and after complaining, they did take the Eggs B off the bill but still came to over £15 (eeeek!!!)The shop itself reminded me of what it would be like if Lush sold food.  Overpriced boutique bottles of lemonade.  And the decor was just trying to hard to be in with the cool kids who wants this sort of crap over a decent greasy caff.in summary. AVOID AVOID AVOID!!!!!

pIxPaanN01pU87jV2stIEw.text: Bills, oh Bills! What can I say - even uttering its very name leaves me salivating at the mouth. Although it's a chain (a small one mind), Bills is one of those rare finds that leaves you completely satisfied, yet craving more the second you've licked your plate clean. It's the crack of the brunch world. Bills is open for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner, but breakfast/brunch is by far the best time to dine. Portions are generous, prices are very reasonable and they don't seem to skimp on anything. The menu has everything from your traditional English fry-up to Eggs Benedict, french toast, fried bubble & Squeak and pastries galore! There's a wealth of choice and all of it looks too good to pass up. Each meal is a classy work of art ready for knife and fork demolition.I've heard rave reviews about their full-English, but I can't ever seem to wrestle myself away from my favorite meal, the veggie breakfast (I'm not even Vegetarian!). Veggies listen up... this is not your usual fair of mushrooms and wilted tomato. Oh no! Bills Vegetarian feast is a mountain of creamy eggs, guacamole, hummus, perfectly sauteed mushrooms, fresh basil leaves and decadent chili sauce all piled high on freshly baked country toast. It's a kaleidoscope of color and flavor in every bite, and to this day, I can honestly say that I haven't had anything quite like it. For £1 more, you can add beans or bubble and squeak to any of the meals mentioned above. If you want to experience the breakfast of dreams, I highly recommend getting the B&S.Bill's is definitely not your local greasy spoon. In the place of dirty lino flooring and wooden paneled walls you get  rustic, French-country decor and a warm ambiance. Bills is homey, comfy and perfectly designed for a lazy Sunday with your (posh) mates.

f5o4nEPJXqoxUmFfSPKQCA.text: I'm not really a fan of the Bill's in Brighton, although for some reason everyone else is. However the new London venue in Covent Garden is a lot better in my opinion.It is a lot smaller so it feels like less of a drafty warehouse but it retains the gimmicky tins of produce like olive oil for all you Bill's fans. The food served is good and the location in a quiet corner of Covent Garden earns it an extra star. All in all a good place to start the day in the West End.

VGUS2HnQkj5_L2iDQqlB2w.text: Atomosphere,staff is so good.I visited with my family and they liked here!!Of course food is good,too.I think there are always good lovely staff in good restaurant.Good services are equal to good restaurant.

Ew4jQuZeQNA7EsWiIx9a9Q.text: To be honest, I had high hopes for a good full English here, but it wasn't that flash. The decor, staff, etc were great. But the meal itself wasn't anything special after a big night out - eggs were perhaps a little overdone.But again, couldn't fault the friendly staff. Might have just gotten them on a bad day.

iI3tcy3U85TxqmnXaho8SQ.text: A few weeks ago I organised my company's christmas party at Bill's and the staff were helpful and diligent. They were amenable to changes in numbers and orders, even when I submitted it later than required. Id never visited Bill's before but I found the atmosphere warm and inviting and the design quirky. The food itself was very nice, simple and came out quickly. The staff as ever were lovely and we were given a nice big area to ourselves. We all agreed that we had a great time and we'd happily visit again!

9Rm39SL-qBCWoqnregH64Q.text: So sad... my second experience at Bill's was not so great...  Work BFF and I decided to take friends here for lunch.  We had to wait for a table, which was fine, although because it was raining outside, it was difficult for all of us to wait inside without getting in the way of everyone.  I was a little surprised that at 3 p.m. this place was still buzzing.Our waitress came over and sat down in the fifth chair and she seemed friendly enough.  We were waiting on one of my friends, but she had told us to go ahead and order.  So we did and the waitress said she would be back when my friend showed up.  We had trouble deciding on what to eat, but eventually we ordered:  Haloumi and Humus, Cod Fish Finger Sandwich, Avocado and Bacon Salad with chicken, and Broad Bean and Pea Risotto.  Although there was an issue with trying to order the Avocado and Bacon Salad with chicken as the waitress kept saying to Work BFF's sister that she could order the Caesar Salad and add avocado and bacon... however that isn't what she wanted.  The waitress came back eventually saying, "I put the order in.  We'll see what we get."  Our starter showed up about 30 seconds before our mains, but it wasn't a huge deal.My friend showed up, but our waitress never did.  We ended up waving down another waitress so she could order.  Our waitress showed up well after she had ordered, however, we decided that we were probably going to want tea/coffee and dessert so asked for the menu, she took off and a few minutes later, she was sitting in the corner eating and texting.  All of a sudden our table had been abandoned.  No waitress was reassigned to us, so we were just sitting there trying to get someone's attention, but because we were in the far corner, it was really difficult to do that.  Eventually we were able to get someone's attention and order two orders of the Mini Cinnamon Donuts, various teas, and a cappuccino.  Tea came out, cappuccino came out, milk and sugar came out, and I saw the donuts come out... but after the waiter looked around, brought it to another table, went back to talk to another waitress, he went back to the kitchen with them.  At this time, Work BFF had received a pot of tea, but no cup for her tea.  Eventually the donuts came back out to our table and Work BFF took the opportunity to ask for a cup.  The waitress went over to the prep area where there were glasses and condiments, she looked around, then stood there talking with someone.  We had to ask someone else.  Another waitress came back (at this point I had lost count of how many waitresses we had asked for help) with the cup, but took the sugar off of the table without asking if Work BFF or anyone else was finished with it, especially since Work BFF had just received her cup.  Annoyed and potentially starting to boil, Work BFF waved the waitress back over and said, "Can we have our sugar back?"  She went to yet another table, asked them if she could take their sugar, then brought it over to us.  When we got the bill, we noticed they had charged the discretionary service charge... everyone at the table agreed we were not paying it.  Now, we are Americans, tipping is part of our culture, and even when we get less than good service, we tend to still leave a little something, but this... this wasn't even worth leaving anything.  It is a good thing we were not in a hurry, but this was just upsetting because the food was really good.  Really good!  The service was shocking, especially after my first visit.  So we put the exact cash for the cost before the service charge and the waitress came over and told us that we were short.  We calmly explained that the service charge is optional and we do not have to pay it.  She walked away still confused, but that was the end of that.  Really disappointing.

O7gd_ILeUqzv84kJX1Gddg.text: I enjoyed the chocolate brownie milkshake to drink which was smooth, rich but not too overwhelming and overall delicious and to eat the very tasty fish finger sandwich which I highly recommend! As usual the service was friendly, cheerful and swift. After each visit to Bill's, I always look forward to the next!

rDl4Vkau5z5e54Q9zbZ0HQ.text: I love Bills! Great place for Brunch or dinner - I've been here a few times to catch up with friends and have always enjoyed it. It has a really warm and friendly environment (love that they have all of their products on the walls too!) When it's busy it can take a little while to get a seat but I've never waited any more than about 10-15 mins. The food is also great value for money considering the quality. They also serve good portions of food. I'm a huge fan of their fish cakes! Staff are very friendly and know how to have a joke or two. In all -a good place to be if you want some great food at a reasonable price!

gm0stAB0cMwT13DllXUI2Q.text: Bill's has a great vibe and is located in the 'hip' new St Martin's Courtyard development in Covent Garden. Despite being ever so slightly off the tourist trail, Bill's has a prime spot right next to the (mentally) popular Jamie's Italian (people were queuing for a table at Jamie's at 5pm on a Sunday evening). If you can't get in at Jamie's, give Bill's a go instead. This is the first Bill's in London, and it's a cafe-cum-grocery-store-cum bar-cum-restaurant type of place. I went here today for hot chocolate and cakes after a "strenuous" afternoon of shopping, and felt very much at home, with jars of yummy preserves adorning the walls, cute candles on the stripped wooden tables and gentle soul music wafting around the colourful room. Nice. Service was a perhaps a little laid back for my liking, and it took a while to be seated, even though there were a few tables available. And the hot chocolate, yet again, WASN'T HOT ENOUGH, despite having requested it to be extra hot. Still, it came with a mound of whipped cream and a flake on top, so musn't grumble. But unfortunately I've minused a star for these factors (yeah, I know I could've sent the hot choc back, but - hey - I'm English). The scones were immense and the jam was so tasty that I shamelessly polished it off with my knife. Oops. You can browse through the grocery list on your table, choose what you want, and the servers will do your shopping for you as you eat and package it all up in a lovely paper bag with hessian ribbon etc etc. Perhaps a bit 'rah' for everyday bits and bobs, but would make a nice present for someone I guess. When I got home an hour or so after leaving Bill's I had chocolate brownie all over my face, which - in my books at least - is a very good sign indeed. JUST MAKE YOUR HOT CHOCOLATE HOTTER!! Even so, I'll definitely be paying Bill's another visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

w8YhYFtJQvY33GJzYl2NUA.text: Had the fish finger sandwich and veggie burger with haloumi, both were great! Staff is really friendly.

6xbCJlXR7PzilC8aO5yJ3Q.text: Is it a shop...is it a cafe?.....I am really still not very sure!had brunch here on Sunday and thought it was ok but rather expensive for what it is. Girl and I shared the mezze and the prawn fishcakes had a drink each and boom there goes £30 after a tip.the taste was good, the portions were small - the greeter (small irish man) was quite aggressive.Not a bad visit but probably woudlnt bother to go back.

7Gv32x5Sp2j6LzL8b5tOtg.text: Definitely a place to go for good brunch specials. Place was packed on a Sunday, but my guest and I were able to squeeze in only after 10 minutes of waiting. We both enjoyed the eggs benedict, tea, and scones. Service was a little slow, but the food definitely made up for it.My only disappointment: They cooked the eggs benedict a little bit over for my tastes; I like the egg yolk to be completely runny--the sides ended up being the texture of a yolk that's hard-boiled.

Xb6cEG2c10lmshDNXacRYg.text: Good brunch option away from the madness of Covent Garden.  As many of the other reviews say, the decor is that of a general store with lots of Bill's home food products on display for purchase.  Exposed ceilings are balanced out with brightly colored stacks of tissue paper (for wrapping purchases) and gives a warm atmosphere.There can be a little bit of a wait, but even with no reservation, the staff are good about getting you seated within 10 minutes or so.  You may have to share a long table with others but it's not cramped at all.  The food is above average but nothing to absolutely die for, juices are fresh squeezed, coffee is freshly brewed, and smoothies are freshly made.  The brunch menu comprises of the usual range of options - we had the vegetarian version of the english breakfast and the eggs royale and both were good.  Service was good with friendly and efficient wait staff.Not amazing, not terrible - good, basic brunch option.

AzH68CMGvMii8rwzERX2fw.text: The venue.I was on my own and arrived at around 8.30. I had to wait around 10 minutes for a table, which I wasn't expecting but they do provide a sofa for waiting diners so it wasn't a problem. However, while I was never made to feel hurried by the excellent staff once I was seated, the busyness of the place doesn't really encourage you to stay much after you've eaten. The food.I ordered the 'Bill's breakfast', which comes with a Cumberland sausage, two fried eggs, tomatoes, mushrooms and toast. I also added the bubble and squeak, which added £1 to the £7.95 basic price for the breakfast and an Americano coffee at £1.95.The quality of the food is excellent, although the sausage (while very good) was a tad small, with nothing on the menu suggesting you can add another one. However the bubble and squeak was fantastic. And while I'm no coffee expert, it was fine.Value.The breakfast with coffee added up to being a bit more than you'd expect to pay in a greasy spoon, for slightly less food. However the quality does compensate. My only grievance regarding price was the addition of an optional service charge. I have no criticism of the service I had at Bill's and was actually prepared to tip over the amount indicated for the charge, but ended up sticking to their total, making me feel a little awkward about not leaving a tip, as such. But that may just be a personal hang up.Summing Up.Bill's offers a good value breakfast if you're looking for something a bit more upmarket than a greasy spoon without wanting to shell out on somewhere like The Wolesley. If only they'd drop the service charge.

_JTfHjG5cxZNXaPHC5F5vw.text: Loved Bill's, the did mess up one item on my order but it was ok, the dish was good.  Loved the eton mess!

m862YglbCT7XONmht-LlLw.text: I love Bill's. I went because it was cheap and had pretty good reviews on yelp, and I was pleasently surprised. As soon as you step in, there's a wow factor from all the things on the wall. Olive oils, jams... So many yummy things to grab and take home! We shared a mezze as a starters which was very very good, with freshly toasted bread: a great start. I had one of the specials: pancetta-wraped chicken which was delicious and perfectly cooked! My boyfriend had a burger which was incredible. Good atmosphere, friendly staff, good pricees and nice quality ! I will def go back !

7g8_gHnmNRIin-PKYt6-Tg.text: I had a wonderful breakfast experience here. The staff were extremely friendly - just what you need on a Sunday morning. The store is excellently presented and extremely colourful with the products giving a real feel of a quaint mix between a country cafe and a general store. The food was hearty and what you'd expect of the Covent Garden area. I'd highly recommend taking friends or even having a date at this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

H9JYT9h3xmCEz7cW1QI7SQ.text: Eggs benedict were "comme il faut" (like it should be) ! Freshly squeezed Juices were amazing...And a great area to walk around for a pleasant afternoon

J1gdUqx35Apse8xRKZOHig.text: After learning that Kopapa's queue was too long to manage on a Sunday morning, my friend and I decided to try out Bill's for brunch. Bill's offers standard brunch fare. I ordered an Eggs Royale and a latte. The food was OK but nothing spectacular. I would recommend coming to Bill's if you're looking for an easy, hassle free breakfast. But if you're in the mood for something that will blow your tastebuds away, I don't think this will satisfy your palate!

LZX_9QoED7Dps7GNz0TXnw.text: My first time at the wonderful Bill's. I've heard many good things about their breakfast, but we went for dinner and it didn't disappoint.The decor is an eclectic hosh posh of candlesticks and tissue wrapping paper, metal ladders and jars of goodies lining the walls. Service was friendly, but a bit slow.It's got food for friends down to a tee. The menu has all the basics - burgers, risotto, fish and chips, but with nice little twists, like the hummus and halloumi burger I had. Desserts were lovely, not mind blowing, but you can't really go wrong with mini cinnamon doughnuts!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Nice chandelier!
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Eton mess
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Warm mini cinnamon doughnuts

x8GV7EYIaX8aA2GB8L_ITQ.text: Another catch-up girly dinner, another crowd-pleasing visit to Bill's!It was my first visit to this branch and I fell smack bang in love with the triple-storey floor to ceiling bookshelves (albeit most were filled with carefully-stacked food tins rather than books - but anyone else who saw Beauty & The Beast and has craved Belle's library ever since will know what I mean!).I was with one of my fussier-eating friends but there's something for everyone on the menu here. My chorizo & hummous burger from the specials was something different and a solid choice (though the chorizo kept trying to escape), and served on a cute chopping board with a mini bucket of shoestring skin-on fries mmm. Among the others, the grilled sea-bream with slaw also looked pretty good, though there wasn't as much fish in the fish finger sandwich as I'd have expected.Service was a bit hit-and-miss sadly - generally took a while to get their attention. Our first server was fun, confident and seemed on the ball until she brought out the wrong bottle of wine. Not a big deal (though it didn't sound anything like the same one). We also made the mistake of saying we weren't in a rush to leave at the end when another waitress told us the card machine was being used on another table. She promptly forgot about us and disappeared, and we finally got someone else's attention after another 15mins.Good-sized portions so we (unusually!) ran out of room for dessert. Still think some of the dishes are on the pricey side for what you get (like the side of sweet potato fries for £3.55?) but overall a solid choice for a group meal - esp if you're not sure how adventurous everyone is food-wise. Great shelves too ;)

DP40PbIRRjyN5Gm62oP1sg.text: I'm a fan of the chain, but this location left me feeling somewhat disappointed. I had booked in for a group of about 10 girlfriends for an afternoon tea. While our table was reserved, we had to wait to get to the table. The main waiter for the table was not responsive, and we had to ask three times for table water. Besides that, the food was great. It's an awesome alternative to an afternoon tea for a lower price.  They offer the champagne tea, but with a twist. I'd go to any of the chains for a quick cup of tea and a nice snack in the afternoon!

AI3kgc3s0fSR9nwg0uLekg.text: Basic eggs benedict. Not perfectly cooked, served with absolutely not side, not even a slice of tomato or an attempt for salad.

ADX1j8s_8K544nGeQ2N-YA.text: I think we bombarded them when our group of 20 came in! According to my friends I ordered all the best stuff. I orders the sausages before my entree and it was delightful. Really nice to share. For my entree to ordered the clams in a creamy white sauce. I'm a big fan of seafood so I really enjoyed it. The presentation was also good- it came in a cute little pot on a plate of wood. The fancy drinks and floats there are also very enjoyable. Nice place for a date and is conveniently located in a nice small plaza. The only thing that went wrong was that when our food came out it came in different orders and some of us took others plates on accident which created a huge confusion. This might be a useful tip I consider for waitresses or waiters: seat numbers really help !

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Our huge party

kVemirFWw8l9WEpO5qAMzQ.text: I have quite mixed feelings about Bills'  having discovered the original Bill's in Brighton quite a few years back I wasn't sure whether I should be happy to have one closer to home.What seems to come natural in Brighton somehow feels a bit forced in Covent Garden.St Martin's Courtyard is a new shopping development and the industrial style interior just doesn't quite ring true here. Especially as the interior designers at Jamie's next door seem to have followed a similar strategy.Still, the atmosphere is casual and comforting  especially on a cold and rainy Sunday afternoon like today's. We popped in for a coffee and just couldn't resist the cakes. The vanilla cheesecake was one of the best I've had since visiting my friend Greg who makes an even better one.You can book online for the evening slots only while brunch/lunch operates on a first come first served basis.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

10fr5SuyZkORbw_hzKHu-A.text: So it probably was not the best idea to come here straight after all the free food samples we tried at a cupcake launch but even though we were quite full, it wasn't dinner and so off we went to Covent Garden. Yes. We're fatties. No, don't judge. I do this in the name of Yelp!  and also i know what you're thinking ; cupcakes before dinner? Do you even know me? Desserts before dinner ALWAYS! I don't take the chance that I 'might' have space for dessert. That's a shit probability.Bills is located in st martins courtyard and the area actually been done up and made lovely with most restaurants having an outside patio. If only it wasn't raining. Anyways got there around 7.30-8pm and there was a half hour wait but given that we'd eaten beforehand, it's okay. I wished they had a bar seating area. I was getting parched waiting. Finally got sat down, under a MASSIVE three longed candlestick ( if you have a fear of fire and hair, move away now lol) ordered two bloody Mary's and a mezzo platter to share. The food, was standard. Sauces were nothing special, it's just a sharing board. But the lighting is pretty , if you're the fire sort of girl, which I am. :) ill be back for the cocktails - small selection but pretty cheap for London. Getting the bill at bills (pahahaha) wasn't that smooth, ended up getting up and asking!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Creme brulee
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Fish pie
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Grilled skewers with tzatziki

kcl3ZgioMKIuegQD7P5o3A.text: We needed a place to go after the theater and this was a great spot. I honestly can't remember one thing I had except for the amazing banana dessert. Great atmosphere!

17-iUTwoCZ0wO86YXGdo9g.text: A very good english breakfast. I tried the Bill's vegetarian one, as advised by another Yelper here... Don't forget that you will eat in a shopping atmosphere, they sell great jams, lemonades, olive oils, etc.You get a very good breakfast for a decent price.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bill's Vegetarian Breakfast... Mmmmh!
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. The breakfast and tea time menu as of 2013-02-19
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Mr Me in front of bottles of lemonade sold there

EvMcO1o4F9Br6XdBHhYtAQ.text: It's a cute little place, but attempts to appeal way too much to American tourists. No lovely English bacon, baked beans and black pudding not included. The eggs were absolutely terrible, had a rubbery texture and no runny yoke. Sausage was good, tomatoes and mushrooms okay. Wouldn't recommend.

cMD8obUMdOUHtDouyPkurw.text: Definitely a hidden gem. When I say hidden, I do not kid! It took my friend & I about 15  mins to find this place!!!Bill's is a cute homey restaurant decorated with their products so you can shop while you ate. And that's what I exactly did! I bought a few jams home to New York for friends & family.My friend & I had brunch here. The food is unbelievably fresh. Food is decently priced. They have apretty large selection as well. The service is pretty good & quick (which is great for a tourist because you're always on the go).I think this was featured in TimeOut magazine. If you're near Covent Garden, brunch here!

x_TtZwgBlP5Net0EJQUitw.text: Excellent service and food! Tomato and red pepper soup was delicious as was the goat cheese and watermelon salad. Calamari was fair. We sat outside on the patio which was lovely, although it seemed like a cool vibe inside as  well. Fairly inexpensive for London prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

RT-kTCSd563lujqDAsV9eg.text: Excellent Service, Great atmosphere, Yummy food... what more could you want?!Came here for Sunday lunch and split a mezze platter. The dips were delicious and the bread was toasted to perfection! When I ordered tea I got a huge teapot all to myself... just what I needed to get my day started. I loved the quirky theme of the restaurant and the great service we got. Will defo be coming here again.

zLnl-1eqf8F826fqivo8pQ.text: Brought my friends from the states to here. There was nice interior decor where they lot candles which gave good feels. The service was excellent too. The food was superb. I got the duck pie which came with those coleslaw dish. The flavor was really good and it was really filling. Do not be deceived by the size, the little dish fills you up fast! Definelty recommend this place If you want a nice looking and affordable place to have a nice meal with your friends.

wpKXXfanvC9hn-lvcWnoLA.text: Went for brunch and I was horribly hungover.I'd been for dinner at the one in Soho and the one in Holborn (separate reviews coming up) and it's always been a safe bet. (at least the one in Soho..) but this one was hmmm.. ok?Brunch was nice, but nothing special. I had green eggs on sourdough with pumpkin seeds, an overpriced smoothie and tea.There are so many better brunch places in London, that I felt I could only give it 3 stars.Wouldn't avoid it, but wouldn't be my first choice.

H2yPpe3gS5DKcpKFg24f7w.text: Welcoming location, imaginative design, friendly staff, very good food. Worth going back to. Enjoyed the vegi breakfast and excellent coffee.

PLc49fWXXVWhgmQlriFuiQ.text: Went to Bill's for breakfast. It's a really nice location but quite busy (on a Friday late morning). French Toast tastes nice, sausage sandwich was a bit disappointing. Service was quite chaotic, no dish arrived at the right table, long wait for drinks and the bill. All in all ok. Location and ambience 4Food 3Service 2

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. French toast is quite nice

Pa9kGgMGdR2iEWcuJWQnyQ.text: Bill's attracted me because of the cool decorations and the quality mediterranean food. The dishes sound and taste quite good but I was a bit disappointed by the sizes. Personally I'm not a fan of huge portions but I felt kinda sorry for my dad and my brother who sure would have welcomed fuller plates. The mains appeared more like starters to be honest. Still they didn't complain because the flavours were good. I might go again if I'm looking for a place where you can easily get a table on a Saturday night.

CDzo7GVsLTaaC2XnvOmR9A.text: Brunch & Coffee SWAG!!  A truly hidden gem off LongAcre near Covent Garden.  This is one of the fresher brunch places in London that is even affordable!  Not a common thing in London!  I had the Eggs Royale or an English version of Eggs Benedict with salmon and pumpkin seeds.   It was quite enjoyable.  The service and the atmosphere make for a great afternoon.  I cannot wait to try some of the other choices like English breakfast and pancakes!

QS7o5FTCftpRdMiAiyLQ5A.text: This place reminds of being back in the states.  Nothing really screams out london at you maybe except for the gin and tonic.  They really take their gin and tonic seriously.  Bill's even have their own gin distilled in house which is kinda cool.The lamb was super tender but the bottom of it was accompanied by a curry mash.  They just had to weave in the indian influence even though dishoom was a few steps away and huge lines to boot.Steak was actually quite flavorful for a causal dining spot.

sfvlZKPo1CRlYiFyUS2kBg.text: Bill's is right next to Covent Garden. It is delicately decorated. Just take your time to enjoy the small details. Servers were very friendly and efficient. We had the Full English Breakfast - SUPERB! ~$10. The portions were great -it does not come with beans which makes it a bit different to the Traditional but perfect for me that I dislike beans! The toast were made out of roustic bread, crunchy but soft in the inside, not the cheap toasts that you get everywhere. And the JAM... Specially made for Bill's by a French Farm. Oh My God!!!! The best Jam I had in my life! The Strawberry tasted as if I had a bunch of sliced Strawberries in my mouth.I will come back!!Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Menu as per March 2018!

oRdqrx4oVhQ9JgVi28qG8Q.text: I had the grain plate.  It was delightful. Full of nuts and seeds that made it so tasty.  I would highly recommend.  I would also recommend the fish and chips.  It was quite good.  I enjoyed having a taste of it and the chips were crunchy and perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom

XgjcDzb0uETG3aiiCaLNHA.text: This place is a SAVIOR for those who sleep until noon three days in a row (not me ) and crave breakfast. One of their lunch plates is pancakes, which are just AMAZING! Not the fluffiest I've ever had, but exactly what I needed. The fruit was also delicious. They give you an optional survey with the check (which they took a very long time to bring). The staff are very friendly. Would totally go back!

RoYMiNUO4bmhIUXhW8rKxg.text: I went here as a quick place with my family since we just got off the flight from LA. The food was fast and delicious. All the waiters were super nice and I loved the whole feel of the place. I really recommend the Tropical Smoothie it  was given to us fast and it is really good. Everything is reasonably priced. Also the location of the place is super beautiful with a flower wall in front of the restaurant. It also includes an outdoor sitting area. Awesome place.

NoZ0uiuo0gHAyf62xmWf_Q.text: We were not able to get into Joe Allen's and they reccomended this place....wish they hadn't.  Mushroom soup was OK, nothing special and the  salad with ancient grains was fine.  Things went downhill after that.  My wife's chicken was so overcooked it was inedible and I had some fish concoction topped with mashed potatoes that was blah.  You would think the waitstaff would look at an uneaten dish and inquire if there was a problem but they didn't. Maybe I am spoiled but I do expect to be offered water and bread, neither of which were forthcoming. My gin and tonic was good but they were quite stingy on the pour of my wife's white wine. I would not return

HGVmyWp5W7GwUQineKezmQ.text: I had better breakfast and I had worst. I always enjoy spending time in a Bill's restaurant because I like the spirit of it. The decorations, the service, the menu... But this time I wasn't wooed by my plate.I choose to eat muesli with honey, yogurt, fruits and tea and it looked very good. The muesli itself looked like a homemade mix, with many different seeds/nuts and dried fruits. The fresh fruits were unfortunately not ripe enough and i had to use a lot of honey to wash out the taste of them.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast muesli honey fruit and yoghurt

K5bPniO2e5X5U1BHu6S5PA.text: Lovely elevated and affordable breakfast in the area. My Bill's Breakfast consisted of two toasts, two sunny side up runny yolks, sausage, portobello mushrooms, roasted sweet tomatoes, and bacons! What's not to like?

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bills Breakfast
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bills Vegetarian breakfast!

sUQ66nFv6DHdP8ERcmHGxA.text: We were greeted by a friendly wait staff when we got there. Just walking in the place, all staff was all smiles and the ambience felt soothing immediately. The coffee was served at the right temperature, total thumbs up to Bill's barista of the day! We had Bill's breakfast and veggie breakfast. The food portion was hearty enough to feed a girl like me who has an appetite of whale! Located at Covent Gardens, I'd have to say that the food pricing would be considered very affordable and this is one chain cafe/restaurant that I'll come back to. Keep up the great quality, portion and service!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Get in us
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bill's breakfast for those keen on some meat to kick start the day!
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. VEGGIE breakfast. . I'm not avocado fan so I got it replaced with bubble squeak! Happy tummy right here

Xqj95_PHPGv97qm-cf2MVw.text: Delicious and well done breakfast. Ive been here twice now and each time gotten different things - avocado toast once and eggs benedict the other time - and Id love to go back and try the pancakes or bills breakfast.Well decorated & nice waitstaff. Overall a solid meal, especially for a chain restaurant (which I normally dislike)

YAi8uu3ZsCqPHVty7Zhwfw.text: Great atmosphere, good food and coffee. Good for families. The neighborhood is a bit sketchy but for breakfast it's alright. Reservations were needed in advance but we got in anyway.

Z8x3TnnuIMYVb33-sZNavg.text: I love Bill's. Bill's Bill's Bill's. Here it goes, down. Down into my belly. Mmm-mm-mmm.Seriously, we had such a great dinner experience here. It was busy, but we were seated within 10-15 minutes after we arrived after being quoted a 20-30 minute wait. Our server never once forgot about us, even with so many other tables in his section, and was able to make recommendations that made it clear he knew the menu well. My boyfriend enjoyed Bill's calamari much more than Sartori, although I thought they were both very good. My paprika-and-lemon chicken with root veggies was incredible, as was the mini doughnut dessert. Everything was delicious, the atmosphere was warm and welcoming, and we would definitely go back if we could.

2DdM-7-lcY8H9sWLBf1K4A.text: This is a chain restaurant, which I've seen in all the touristy areas of London - Westfield, High Street Kensington, Covent Garden...As it's a chain, I arrived intending to hate it. The menu looked long, which in my experience is never a good sign as it means the chef can't specialise on doing a few things well.But it turns out I was completely wrong as the long menu just means that there are more options - there's a meal for every mood.Feeling healthy? Try the salad, which is substantial. The sea bass is also mighty fine.Need a treat? There's a lot of hearty meat based dishes on the menu. Prices are really affordable for central London - you can have a very good quality and filling meal for two including a drink for £40 and that includes the tip. Cocktails start at just £5, which is incredibly cheap. Make sure to save room for the Eton Mess dessert - it's divine.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bill's delicious Eton Mess
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Mini sausages starters

lfM8NSHYZGE4nOmaSzNp6g.text: Stopped by on our last day in London for breakfast. My sister was determined to not leave London without eating a full english breakfast with beans. Unlike some of the other breakfast places in the area - this had no wait A+. The decor was super cute, the shelves are lined with jams and foods that you can purchase after your meal. As for the food, our family ordered: - Bill's Bread Basket (3.95): Came with a variety of breads and some jams- Bill's Breakfast (7.95): Sausage, Eggs, Mushrooms, bacon and toast. Super good! Definatly a must try. - Egg's Royal (7.95): Eggs benedict with smoked salmon instead. The hollandaise was to die for- Cumberland sausage served in toasted brioche roll (4.25): MUST TRY!! Looked AND tasted amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bread basket with different types of jams
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Interior
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Bills Breakfast

6HeGfeQ4LAIfokqPB0QC4w.text: Incredible brunch and great, hip atmosphere. We are big on vibes - and this place has chill music, a comfortable environment, and most importantly delicious food. My husband and I visited on a Monday morning and had no issue getting a table immediately.  We ordered the bread basket (highly recommend) and got an assortment of freshly baked croissants and breads - all still warm from the oven. I ordered the avocado toast with scrambled eggs and my husband got the pancakes and bacon - we both ate every bite! Also - the Americanos were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes and bacon
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Avocado toast

_dH8UJRH9AAeqEWz28SdqQ.text: I think I just love Bill's too much and too biased haha! Was telling myself that I'll have to allocate some breakfast to try out other restaurants during my short time in London, but still ended up having two breakfasts here!Always love the atmosphere and decor, very comfortable and homey, even though it feels like you are eating in a hipster corner/convenient/grocery store lol.I always ordered a pot of tea with Bill's breakfast. The pot of tea was huge and the full breakfast's portion was big and delicious. Though many locals came and bought coffee to-go, made me wonder if I should try out Bill's coffee. However, my reflex every time was to get tea and usually I was too full to get another cup of coffee...maybe next time. :PAlso tried pancakes due to friend's recommendation. It was good and different from what I usually have! At first I was wondering if the syrup was enough (I am so Americanized in this aspect...), but found out that the pancake batter was already seasoned! With a hint of saltiness and extra jam/berry in the middle, it was delicious. There were also some fresh fruits on it. The price with the quality and portion was pretty good, I have not yet try other meal here yet. Though Bill's will always be the place to go for breakfast when I am in London!

OXzcx5iDC8c1sNWHZvMMCA.text: We were heading to London on the weekend and as we were so tight for time ( travelling there & back & doing a show all in one day), I wanted somewhere I could book online and be sure of prompt service. I needed somewhere with interesting food but also with plain options (steak, for my fussy dad), good cocktails & reasonably priced. After trying Bills in a few cities I thought it was worth a shot in London.It was easy to get a table for 4 at lunchtime by booking online a week before. I picked this branch as it was central & a short distance from the theatre. We arrived on a sunny lunchtime and this is where it loses a star...the position of the outdoor space was out of the sun! Not really Bill s fault though! We took a table inside & im glad we booked as there was a queue out the door & we were given a lovely table in a quiet spot next to a sunny window on the second floor. No one barging past us & nice & close the bathroom ( which was tiny but clean). The brunch menu was still in operation at 12.15 but luckily we could pick from the lunch time menu. There is a great selection and we decided to go for burgers taking advantage of upgrading our burgers with additional items. I picked to have avocado on my buttermilk chicken! My dad had the steak and chips (no salad, no blood) & ordered rosemary and potato bread to go with it.The drinks arrived quickly, we went for a rosehip gin based cocktail, Camden Hells for the boy & cider for my dad. I like that the range of drinks are quite independent, different from other chains. After this cocktail we ordered Bills green garden, another gin based cocktail, this one fresh with the taste of elderflower, cucumber and apple. It was so delicious that we will serve it at our wedding. The food arrived! Thankfully my dad s food arrived as ordered! My burger came with the avocado on the side which worked well but I expected it to be on the burger as it was ordered as an addition not a side. The buttermilk chicken was a good size and well coated and I enjoyed the sour dough bun it arrived on. The sweet potato fries were crispy and not greasy. The chipotle mayo ensured that the burger had a kick. The beef burger looked incredible too - moist beef that is served medium or well done & this time with skin on fries. There must have been plenty as my mum was sharing them out! Tables were cleared promptly and dessert menus arrived! We were so full (& had spotted a gelato parlour) that we decided to leave it! None of the options set my world on fire so hopefully these will be reviewed when a new menu is put together. It was missing a light option outside of the ice cream. I really do love the concept and styling of Bills and how I can buy a teapot or biscuits while I'm there! If you re in London, check this branch out!

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Buttermilk burger

5qfwFVI-yQlfD8FCzGjFdA.text: Bill's Restaurant for breakfast is awesome. It is a chain but the service is individual. The athmosphere is nice and calming. We loved the industry design of the place. Pancakes and British breakfast were very good. We can recommend this place. Tea was okayish. Food wasn't exactly light. But that was our choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Nice atmosphere

aEiLUjxp3KfFzR592K6DZQ.text: Not bad Bill's. Not bad.I came here with some friends for lunch and loved the views from upstairs! It was a chilled, relaxing lunch with lovely food. My "lighter main" of marinated chicken skewers with tzatziki and cous cous was huuuge and really filling. So much so that I couldn't even contemplate dessert. My friend's food looked similarly lovely (and huge!)Service:This lets the place down for me...the lady that served us might have been in a grumpy mood (or maybe her 'resting' face was just naturally sour!?) She took such a long time to even allow us to order, then we thought she'd forgotten about our drinks because they took so long. When we checked if they were on the way, I felt like a naughty school girl. Don't cross your waitress here!!I think I'd like to come back, and just hope for a different waitress. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom. Lovely chicken skewers

tlHXuOmEisufoBiiUb_QzA.text: We were at Bill's twice. Great experience with fantastic food. All the servers were friendly. Gets very busy, go early.

photos.caption: Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bill's - London, United Kingdom
